storyInfo: The Nachzehrer King receives an aid request from the battlefield's rear, and decides to withdraw from the front lines to attend to the matter personally. The Duke of Wellington also carries out an action that runs contrary to his plan. The battle situation immediately shifts, and the Duke of Caster's warship, the Glorious, is crushed in an instant.

attributes.content: Sixty-eight hours into the operation...
Smoke and thick fog tug and tear at one another.
The deck of the Gastrell is teeming with the seeds and withered branches of the Nachzehrers. Seventy percent of the guns that once breached countless fortresses have now fallen silent.
Its teeth almost completely pulled and its talons whetted smooth, the logical next step is for this prey to be dismantled and devoured.
However, the Nachzehrer's throne has also been pierced by dozens of chain-ladled fortcrackers.
With just one move, the God of War could be pulled from his throne.
You have proven to me... that war marches on.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Two hundred years ago, no Victorian would have come even this far.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Heh... And you, Sarkaz. You've proven that you're not just some decrepit old shadow.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: You are indeed a threat to this great land. Perhaps my warship should've paid you a visit sooner, after I tore Gaul apart.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: You would have been afforded no such opportunity.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: None of you.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: A Confessarius transmission.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: Yes... In the direction of the Blood of Teekaz.
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer King takes in the entirety of the battlefield.
The enemy is trying to halt the storm. This might change the flow of battle, but it is hardly decisive. Even without the Catastrophe, his warriors are just as savage, just as unrelenting.
Wellington is a worthy opponent, but the fetters of time will soon drag him away. He has no place among the future's wars.
The true threat comes from elsewhere. It comes... from behind.
Theresis and the Confessarius have reminded me that this is not the only battlefield.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: Will you attend to it personally?
attributes.name: Sudaram

attributes.content: I have already received the wars promised to me by the Military Commission, present and future.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: The Nachzehrers must also fulfill their pact with the Regent.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: But before I leave, I must sow some seeds of decay on this battlefield for me to reap upon my return.
attributes.name: Nezzsalem

attributes.content: A thick haze rises.
Upon the battlefield, only the throne remains.
Is that Nachzehrer... running away?
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: No. In a real war, there is no retreat.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Wait, General! Look at the throne!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: There's some kind of mist pouring from it...
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough*... That isn't any ordinary mist! It's... eating me from the inside!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: General, your body–
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: Soldier, status report on the Gastrell.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Damage to the cabins in excess of sixty percent. Per your previous orders, propulsion capabilities are largely intact! As for weapons–
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: Remove anything that's basically unusable and discard it on the spot.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Roll out the Originium cannons from the lower deck.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Those are already...
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: Obsolete. But still enough to kill.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Yessir!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: Notify the Gastrell to retreat to G-0 high ground according to the plan, and continue to consolidate defenses there.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: We will also follow at speed, while ordering all current battle lines to fall back.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Next, we'll send these Sarkaz over to Caster and Gododdin to handle.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Any news from Shay?
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: The captain and Lady Eblana have captured most of the Nachzehrer altars in this area!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: Yes, I saw. Her flames are... very vivid.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: Medic!
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: General?
attributes.name: Redsteel Guard Member

attributes.content: ...Heh.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: A battle with no decisive conclusion... will not be my last.
attributes.name: Duke of Wellington

attributes.content: 'Alliance Fleet Command Emergency Transmission–'
Three minutes left.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: We should be able to hear gunfire from our current position.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Yes, Your Grace. Wellington's column is not far from ours, ensuring we'll be able to provide mutual support.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: This battle will determine Victoria's fate.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Indeed, if all goes well–
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Then we'll be able to end this meaningless stalemate as quickly as possible.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Those eyes truly burn with a lust for battle.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Do you think he has any ulterior motives?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: For two decades, my desk has been filled with intel related to him, along with its response proposals. As of late, these reports have been updating a dozen times a day.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The true struggle begins after the Sarkaz have been dealt with.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: But at this moment... Wellington isn't the only one who needs a decisive victory.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The time has come. The assault is about to commence, and he has never failed to be punctual.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Ahh, do you hear that?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: The Gastrell's full broadside... Such a different timbre it is compared to our ships.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: But after this battle, Caster's name will shine alongside Wellington's in the annals of Victorian military history–
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: 'Anomaly, anomaly. 00 and 01! Repeat! 00 and 01!'
Drat, the comms have been cut?!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Your Grace, all signals from the Duke of Wellington... have vanished.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: A group of Sarkaz suddenly emerged from the Catastrophe and have engaged in battle with our frontline troops!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: What the hell is Wellington doing?! Acting alone at a time like this... that vainglorious fool! Has he gone senile?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Impossible.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I do have a conjecture, though. Do you think he deceived Caster? Or rather, everyone?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That... doesn't make any sense. This is the Iron Duke we're talking about. Why would he abandon the other, more easily-manipulated dukes to go ally with the Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: It's a game of prisoner's dilemma among the dukes.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: How would the Duke of Windermere, a warrior, treat her foes?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: ...She'd kill them all.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: And wipe the last speck of their blood across their seized spoils.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Before he became first among the Victorian dukes, Wellington had already been leading troops for decades longer than your mother.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: As a noble among nobles, Caster was used to everyone playing by the same set of rules.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: After spending too long seated in front of the card table, she might've forgotten that some unreasonable people, such as us gangster types, have a penchant for flipping the entire table.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Hypothetically, if the Iron Duke truly saw all of Victoria as enemies rather than competitors – he'd never even give Caster a single chip to bargain with.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Catastrophe!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The next wave of Catastrophes struck far sooner than any of the Catastrophe Messengers predicted – all our comms have been knocked offline!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: How long for repairs?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Fifteen minutes. No, we'll make it ten!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: ...Your Grace.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You came back on Wellington's orders.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You're heavily injured. Who's responsible?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Not any of the Iron Duke's men.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: He... lost to that Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: After the Gastrell opened fire, the Nachzehrers' advance brigade emerged from the fog.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: They moved extremely quickly, using already-deployed altars to destroy a small warship – Abercorn's infantry had already engaged them for a spell.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: We expected the Gastrell to aid this ship.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: He retreated instead.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: That's right. The Gastrell has turned back.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: All of Wellington's other ships are covering the flagship's retreat. Their casters... have also changed targets, relying on the covering fire from our ships to secure their own vessel's retreat.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What about Abercorn and Ashworth's ships?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Completely exposed to the Nachzehrers' assault.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: They expected to show up as support – but now find themselves facing the enemies head-on.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Wellington's ships have completely blocked off the retreat. He's even trying to push Abercorn and the others towards the front lines.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: It won't be long until the remaining alliance forces are wiped out... and become sustenance for the Nachzehrers.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Your Grace, the alliance forces dispatched to the heart of the battle has collapsed, and the Sarkaz will soon return to the rear where we're situated.
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The plan to cut off and encircle the Sarkaz has failed! We're at risk of getting surrounded ourselves!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: At risk?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: No, it's already too late.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: What's enveloping us... is much more than the Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: ...Nachzehrers!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The signal's back online, and we've run into a large contingent of Nachzehrers... No, it's an entire army!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: There's another force approaching from the right... Is that their second army?
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: They've already begun fighting. The Catastrophe is amplifying the Nachzehrers' witchcraft—!
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: The Originium response is spiking sharply! Your Grace, watch yourself–
attributes.name: Flag Officer

attributes.content: Troops on the battlefield still able to receive any feeble signals at all simultaneously are sent a staticky message––
The Glorious has been confirmed destroyed.
Vina remembers the first time she saw a high-speed battleship.
It was sitting on her father's desk. A small scale model, only as long as an adult's forearm. Its crystal flagpole would fall over with just a little poke.

Her father pushed her touchy-feely hands away, telling her that high-speed battleships are akin to metallic monsters that conquer the land. They, like the indomitable city of Londinium, were the crowning jewels of Victoria's industrial technology.
'Alexandrina, when you are older, I will take you aboard the newest battleship. You will see for yourself.'
Many years later, when Vina did in fact see one, it was only upon the battlefield.
Be it Windermere's, Caster's, or Wellington's warship, they were so majestic that the people standing beneath them were mere specks in comparison.
But at this moment, the broken warship in the palm of the colossal Originium wave before her seems to have reverted to the tiny toy she played with in her childhood.
That... Originium Wave, crushed the Glorious into pieces.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: My eardrums... are still aching––
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The sound of a warship being destroyed... I doubt there's anyone nearby who didn't hear it...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The duke driving that huge thing... is dead, just like that?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Grr... Hey, Dagda, you'd better not shit yourself.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You're the one whose hands are shaking.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: You've been quiet this whole time, Dagda. What's on your mind?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: They made an example of the Duke of Caster at this critical juncture. The Sarkaz intentions are all too clear.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: What might that be? A warning?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: No, it's a message. A message that the Sarkaz are about to launch an all-out attack.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Inform all our comrades and prepare for the next assault–
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Duke of Caster's not dead.
Horn! Our morale's completely shot right now...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That was quite the commotion just now. Nobody has ever seen anything like that before... including us.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But, the captain's already sent out a bunch of old vets to tag along with you and calm down the fresh greens. Aye, looks like it's been workin' out.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Bagpipe, don't hold them to our standards, even if you're just doing it subconsciously. The Exemplars just happen to be a particularly special case.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Aye. Got it, Captain.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Horn, you just said... that the Duke of Caster is still alive? You seem quite certain about that.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Take a look – the muzzles of the Glorious's cannons have been locked on since the very beginning.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: There might be countless criticisms about Victoria's grand dukes... But holding that position for decades is no easy feat.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Since the Glorious has not ceased its resistance, that means the Duke of Caster has not perished.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: As for the actual situation... maybe that's something a Trilby Asher can clear up for us.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: He left the moment the Glorious started to run into trouble.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: He might be in the vicinity trying to a get in contact with the Glorious to figure out what's actually going on.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But from what he told us, the Stone of the Sword we're looking for is also right there–
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Siege, what's our next move?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We've just heard back from the outpost!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The Glorious has been completed surrounded by the Royal Court's blitz attack, and the Duke of Wellington has suddenly withdrawn his forces.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The situation in the surrounding areas has rapidly deteriorated––
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Vina, I'm afraid that... we'll have to halt our march at once.
attributes.name: Delphine
